title: Fix queue changes not being applied with shuffle
message:
Fix queue changes not being applied with shuffle

Resolves an issue where enabling shuffle could prevent changes to the queue from being applied caused by how shuffling was implemented. In the previous implementation, MusicPlayer would pass its shuffled queue reference to the backing QueuedExoPlayer. When MusicPlayer gets a call to update its queue, it would shuffle it into the current list instance. Because this instance was held by QueuedExoPlayer, when it would be passed to QueuedExoPlayer, it would decide that the queue has not changed, and would not rebuild the timeline or mark the queue as invalid.

This commit resolves this issue by not reusing lists when the queue is reshuffled

Fix queue position updates not scrolling queue

Every time the queue index is updated, the queue fragment previously would trigger a dataSetChanged event. Because of changes to RecyclerView, this would invalidate all of the views currently displayed. This invalidation reset the indices of views in the adapter to NO_POSITION, which is a value needed by shouldScrollToNowPlaying(). To fix this, the queue is only changed when it actually updates.

title: Fix incorrect padding at bottom of queue list

Due to changes in the RecyclerView library, the previous implementation of the queue padding (having a single view whose height changes) no longer works. To resolve this, multiple spacers are shown instead. The height of each spacer is the same as the height of a list item (except for the first one, which is the remainder). To update the padding, we show and hide the number of shown spacers to set the total amount of spacing according to whatever song is playing.

When opening Jockey in multi-window on a phone (e.g. the Google Pixel XL), Jockey's skip buttons will be clipped when the phone is in portrait when Jockey is allocated to 1/3 or 1/2 of the screen. Move Multi-Repeat setting into a process-specific SharedPreferences

Because the Multi-Repeat value needs to always be writeable from the remote process, this PR creates a separate RemotePreferenceStore to hold the value. This is backed by a different SharedPreferences file so that there are no conflicts when using preferences among two processes. This commit also implements the Multi-Repeat behavior on the service and allows its current value to be get and set with PlayerController.

message:
Fix album grid frame colors not updating

Fixes an issue where palette generation in AlbumViewModel would not update the view in release builds. This was because AlbumViewModel uses an ObjectAnimator to change the value of an ObservableInt. When Proguard obfuscated property names, the set(int) method could no longer be accessed by ObjectAnimator because it uses reflection to access JavaBean-style setters and could not find the renamed method. This commit resolves the issue by preserving the names of all members in any class that extends BaseObservable (including ObservableInt) when Proguard runs.

Make rule filtering faster

With the current implementation of LocalMusicStore, calls to getSongs(Album|Artist) are implemented by reading the MediaStore with a Cursor. This is inefficient because opening Cursors is expensive and these values are already stored as properties on the song model object. This commit changes the implementation of the Album and Artist rule so that instead of getting the song contents from the MediaStore with LocalMusicStore, they manually perform a linear search through the song library comparing whether or not each song should be included or not based on its album or artist id.

title: Fix playlists getting cleared when they are edited
message:
Fix playlists getting cleared when they are edited

As of commit 7586dd4b30cfe5ca29e5bfacd562ef14ed285c22,
when playlist entries were loaded  their child songs were
assigned incorrect ID's. As a result, because of the playlist
editing implementation, when moving items or removing
individual items, the entire playlist would be cleared in the
MediaStore.

This has been fixed by assigning the correct ID to the
Playlist entries when they are loaded.

title: Performance improvements in IPC
message:
Performance improvements in IPC
 - Less reliance on Intent broadcasts to update the main UI process
 - Activities no longer register themselves as broadcast receivers, instead they implement PlayerController.UpdateListener which has one method (update()) which is called whenever the player service has changed state
 - UPDATE broadcasts are now only sent when the player changes its state from the notification or in the background (like when a song finishes). PlayerController will update all registered UpdateListeners when any action is made on the UI thread that changes the player state
